title: See and Do | The Frick Pittsburgh Museums & Gardens
content:
##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

## See and Do

# Customize Your Frick Experience

With so much to see and do, every visit to the Frick can be different. Experience the culture and refinement of the Gilded Age in a beautiful setting no other museum in Pittsburgh can offer..

##### Grable Visitor Center

Start your visit here! Purchase tickets, shop, and learn about the Frick site.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/grablevisitorcenter "grable visitor center")

[Grable Visitor Center](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/grablevisitorcenter "Grable Visitor Center")

##### Clayton

Immerse yourself in the restored home of the Frick family.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Clayton)

##### The Frick Art Museum

View stunning temporary exhibitions and our permanent collection.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/thefrickartmuseum)

##### Car and Carriage Museum

Explore the Frick's collection of turn of the 20th century cars and carriages.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/carandcarriagemuseum "car and carriage museum")

[car and carriage museum](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/carandcarriagemuseum "car and carriage museum")

##### Greenhouse and Gardens

Stroll the 10-acre campus¬†and visit a working Greenhouse.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/greenhouse-gardens)

##### Playhouse

Imagine playing in your own personal playhouse, complete with bowling alley!

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/playhouse)

##### The Caf√©

Enjoy a treat at The¬†Caf√© at the Frick Tuesday‚ÄìSunday, 9:30 AM‚Äì3 PM.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/cafe)

##### Community Room

The perfect venue for a meeting or small event.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/communitycenter)

## What's Happening at the Frick

There‚Äôs always something going on at The Frick Pittsburgh. We offer a variety of inspiring programs and events for visitors of all ages.

##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

Now On View

# The Scandinavian Home

[Coziness Awaits](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-The-Scandinavian-Home-Landscape-and-Lore)

National Award-Winning Tour

[Immerse Yourself in 1892](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Signature-Clayton-Tour-Experience-Gilded-Not-Golden)

Now a Nationally Registered Historic Place

[From Home to Museum](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Clayton-Preservation-Tour)

1/6

## Your Next Visit Awaits

If you‚Äôre looking for a serene place to [watch the leaves change](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/plan-your-visit) while [sipping on a warm drink](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/cafe), our museums and gardens have something for everyone to do this autumn. Coziness awaits for you in [_The Scandinavian Home: Landscape and Lore_](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-The-Scandinavian-Home-Landscape-and-Lore) exhibition where domestic and mythic intertwine. You‚Äôll delve deeper into 1892‚Äîa pivotal and complicated year for Pittsburgh and the Frick family alike‚Äîon our award-winning tour of Clayton, [_Gilded, Not Golden_](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Signature-Clayton-Tour-Experience-Gilded-Not-Golden). As one of Pittsburgh‚Äôs best backyards, come relax and enjoy art, history, and nature with us all fall long!

[Plan your visit](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/plan-your-visit)

Today at the frick

#### Saturday, October 4    Open 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM

8:00 AM - 8:00 PM [Duquesne SoundWalk at the Frick](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Duquesne-SoundWalk-at-the-Frick)

10:00 AM - 5:00 PM [_Catching Sunbeams from the Porch Swing of Wisteria Castle_](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Catching-Sunbeams-from-the-Porch-Swing-of-Wisteria-Castle)

10:00 AM - 5:00 PM [_The Scandinavian Home: Landscape and Lore_](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-The-Scandinavian-Home-Landscape-and-Lore-The-Frick-Pittsburgh-Museums-Gardens)

10:00 AM - 5:00 PM [Car and Carriage Museum](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Car-and-Carriage-Museum)

[view all of todays events](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar)

TOUR CLAYTON

#### Gilded, Not Golden

Immerse yourself in 1892, a pivotal year for our nation, Pittsburgh, and the Frick family.

_"The tour was by far one of the best I've had. The tour guide was so informative and insightful." - Martiza T._

[Visit Clayton](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Signature-Clayton-Tour-Experience-Gilded-Not-Golden "Visit Clayton")

[Visit Clayton](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Signature-Clayton-Tour-Experience-Gilded-Not-Golden "Visit Clayton")

Enjoy A Meal

#### The Caf√© at the Frick

Enjoy casual dining with a picturesque view of Pittsburgh's best backyard. Sample savory lunch options, daily afternoon teas, curated coffees and cocktails, and more!

[View The Menu](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/cafe)

[View The Menu](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/cafe "View The Menu")

Travel Through Time

#### The Car and Carriage Museum

Travel back to the time of horse-drawn carriages, see some of the first horseless carriages to have an impact on Pittsburgh, and learn about Pittsburgh√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s role in the developing automobile industry.

[Free To Visit](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/carandcarriagemuseum)

[Free To Visit](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/carandcarriagemuseum "Free To Visit")

Take A Stroll

#### Scenic Gardens & Greenhouse

The path that winds through the Frick‚Äôs 10-acre site is lined with lush gardens and a diverse selection of trees. Our active greenhouse is a renovation and partial reconstruction of one that served the Frick family from 1897 through the 1970s.

[Plan your visit](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/plan-your-visit)

[visit](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/plan-your-visit "visit")

Join & Support

## Members Visit Free!

[Join Us](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/membership)

See & Do

#### Upcoming Events

### Clayton Preservation Tour

Saturday, October 4

10:45 AM - 1:45 PM

Explore Clayton's evolution from a family home to a public museum on this specialty preservation tour at The Frick Pittsburgh.

[More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Clayton-Preservation-Tour) [View all events](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar)

Oct 4

Saturday, October 4

1:00 PM - 3:30 PM

Join a guided tour of Scandinavian Home to explore the art, culture and identity of Scandinavia. Tours are available on Wednesdays, Fridays, and Saturdays throughout the exhibition's run.

[More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Guided-Exhibition-Tours-of-The-Scandinavian-Home-Landscape-and-Lore) [View all events](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar)

Oct 4

### _Master of the House_ Film Screening: A Cinematic and Musical Homage to Scandinavian Home and Heritage

Saturday, October 4

4:00 PM - 6:30 PM

On October 4, join The Frick Pittsburgh for a rare and resonant cinematic experience inspired by The Scandinavian Home: Landscape and Lore exhibition.

[More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Master-of-the-House-Film-Screening-A-Cinematic-and-Musical-Homage-to-Scandinavian-Home-and-Heritage) [View all events](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar)

Oct 4

Saturday, October 4

6:30 PM - 8:00 PM

On October 4, enhance your silent film festival experience with an exclusive post-screening meet-and-greet reception in The Frick Art Museum.

[More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Experience-Add-On-Post-Performance-Reception-for-Master-of-the-House-Film-Screening) [View all events](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar)

Tuesday, October 7

10:00 AM - 12:00 PM

Visit The Scandinavian Home exhibition and reconnect with nature through a slow, restorative experience facilitated by certified forest bathing practitioners from the Frick Environmental Center.

[More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Forest-Bathing-Mindful-Nature-Experience-Oct-7) [View all events](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar)

Thursday, October 9

Join The Frick Pittsburgh for a special Summer Tea Series at The Cafe at the Frick, held on the second Thursday of the month from June to October.

[More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Summer-Tea-Series) [View all events](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar)

Oct 9

Friday, October 10

6:30 PM - 8:30 PM

[More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Spooky-Spirits-Walk-Oct-10) [View all events](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar)

Oct 10

### From The Little Match Girl to The Little Mermaid: Illustrating Hans Christian Andersen

Sunday, October 12

2:00 PM - 3:00 PM

On October 12, join The Frick Pittsburgh for a lecture by Dr. Kahren Jones Arbitman that celebrates Denmark's world-renown master of enchantment, Hans Christian Andersen.

[More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-From-The-Little-Match-Girl-to-The-Little-Mermaid-Illustrating-Hans-Christian-Andersen) [View all events](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar)

Oct 12

### Spooky Spirits Walk

Friday, October 17

6:30 PM - 8:30 PM

On Oct. 17, 2025, get in the spooky spirit and explore the haunting history of Pittsburgh's East End on a guided walk of The Frick Pittsburgh's grounds.

[More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Spooky-Spirits-Walk-Oct-17) [View all events](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar)

Oct 17

### Family Mornings in The Scandinavian Home

Saturday, October 18

10:15 AM - 11:30 AM

Explore the Scandinavian Home: Landscape and Lore exhibition through play during these bimonthly drop-in gallery experiences! Family Mornings happen one Thursday and Saturday a month.

[More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Family-Mornings-in-The-Scandinavian-Home) [View all events](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar)

Oct 18

### Collectors' Talk with Dr. David and Susan Werner

Saturday, October 18

4:00 PM - 5:00 PM

Dr. David and Susan Werner join the Frick's chief curator and director of collections, Dawn Brean, in a conversation about their passion for collecting Scandinavian and Nordic art.

[More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Collectors-Talk-with-Dr-David-and-Susan-Werner) [View all events](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar)

Oct 18

Sunday, October 19

2:00 PM - 5:30 PM

Experience the lore of Scandinavia through the tabletop roleplaying game, Vaesen.

[More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Vaesen-Roleplaying-Game-Session) [View all events](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar)

2:00 PM - 3:00 PM

Saturday, November 1

9:30 AM - 3:30 PM

content:
##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

Corporate Sponsorship

# Educational Improvement Tax Credit Program (EITC)

The Educational Improvement Tax Credit Program is a Pennsylvania tax credit for businesses who make a donation to an approved nonprofit organization.¬† The Frick Art Pittsburgh, a valuable source of innovative learning and inspiration, is an approved Educational Improvement Organization.

Companies making a contribution to the Frick through EITC can receive significant tax benefits.¬† Approved corporations can receive tax credits equal to 75 percent of its contribution up to a maximum of $750,000 per taxable year.¬† Businesses who agree to provide the same amount for two consecutive tax years can receive 90% of the contribution as a tax credit.¬† This can mean you receive up to 90% of your gift total as a tax credit: your $10,000 gift could result in a credit as high as $9,000.

Contact Manager of Insitutional Support¬†Jodi Golomb¬†for details at 412-342-4089¬†or [JGolomb@TheFrickPittsburgh.org](mailto:JGolomb@thefrickpittsburgh.org).

## EITC in 3 Easy Steps

#### [Step 1\  Determine if you qualify.](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/eitc\#acc1-tab1)

- Bank and Trust Company Shares Tax
- Corporate Net Income Tax
- Capital Stock and Franchise Tax
- Mutual Thrift Institutions Tax
- Shareholder and Partner personal income tax (S Corps and Partnerships with pass-through tax liability)

#### [Step 2\  Apply.](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/eitc\#acc1-tab2)

Eligible businesses can apply to participate in the EITC program [here.](http://dced.pa.gov/programs/educational-improvement-tax-credit-program-eitc)

#### [Step 3\  Make the Frick the recipient of your EITC-eligible contribution](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/eitc\#acc1-tab3)

Once your application has been approved by the Department of Community and Economic Development (DCED), your business must contribute to a qualified organization, such as the Frick, within 60 days.¬† You need to send proof of the contribution to DCED within 90 days of the approval.¬† The Frick will send you an acknowledgement letter as proof of your contribution, and you are required to send a copy of this letter to DCED.

## Your support impacts thousands of students

In addition to receiving tax benefits, your EITC gift supports impacts thousands of students by helping to underwrite various types of programs and visits by school groups throughout the region.¬† The Frick‚Äôs meaningful and standards-based education programs enhance the experiences of children and underserved students.¬† Using interactive activities and adaptive lessons, we engaged students in a meaningful way with our interdisciplinary collections.

[Learn¬†more about education at the Frick >>](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/learn)

In recognition of your support, the Frick will list your organization name among¬†[Our Supporters](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/oursupporters).

##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

## Plan Your Visit

# Ready to explore?

At The Frick Pittsburgh, get ready to experience art, history, and nature.

To ensure you enjoy as much as possible during your visit, check our **[calendar](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar)**¬†for all offerings and get your tickets in advance. Clayton tours are limited and do sell out!

For the best experience, begin your visit at Grable Visitor Center. A Museum Experience Associate will orient you to our campus and help you purchase day-of tickets, if available.

[Tickets](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/tickets)

Visit

## Hours & Admission

Admission to the gardens, permanent collection of The Frick Art Museum, and a section of the Car and Carriage Museum is always free.

Admission fees apply to¬†certain special¬†exhibitions in The Frick Art Museum, Car and Carriage Museum, and to Clayton tours.

Clayton tours do sell out and advanced purchase is¬†strongly recommended.

Getting Here

## Directions to the Frick

The Frick is approximately 20 minutes east of downtown Pittsburgh at the corner of Penn and South Homewood avenues in Point Breeze. The entrance is located on Reynolds Street where parking is available in our free lot.

From downtown Pittsburgh, the Pittsburgh Airport or PA Turnpike, the Frick is reached via the Parkway East (I-376). Exit at #77‚ÄìEdgewood Swissvale (take the Edgewood ramp), follow Braddock Ave. to Penn Ave. and turn left. Continue four blocks and turn left on South Homewood Ave. Proceed one long block to traffic circle (Reynolds St.) and follow signs to parking lot entrance.

**PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION**

Pittsburgh Regional Transit buses 67, 69,¬†and 71C\* provide service from downtown Pittsburgh.

_\*Starting October 1, 2023, the 71C will terminate in Oakland and no longer serve Uptown and downtown Pittsburgh. Please plan accordingly. [Learn more about the schedule changes on Pittsburgh Regional Transit's website](https://www.rideprt.org/schedules/Service-adjustments/)._

# Gifts of Stock

_Using appreciated stock is an excellent way to make a gift to the Frick because it offers significant tax benefits without affecting your cash flow._

**Gifts of stock or appreciated assets**

Many donors choose to make gifts of appreciated stocks or mutual funds to offset an anticipated capital gains tax.¬†Even better, you can take a sizeable charitable deduction on your taxes‚Äîa deduction that can be used to offset other taxes. Stock or other appreciated assets can also be used to fund a charitable trust or life income agreement.

**Transfer of Stock**

Before transferring stock to the Frick, please notify us of your intentions and the details of your gift, including stock type and number of shares to be transferred.¬† We will need this information to properly credit you and issue a receipt for tax purposes.¬† Below is the information to provide to your broker for an electronic transfer of your gift:

PNC Bank

title: Exhibitions | The Frick Pittsburgh Museums & Gardens
content:
##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

## The Frick Pittsburgh Museums and Gardens

# Exhibitions

The Frick offers an exciting schedule of special exhibitions featuring art and artists from the Renaissance to the present.

Through January 11, 2026

### The Scandinavian Home: Landscape and Lore

From Sept. 27, 2025 - Jan. 11, 2026, escape to the magical, mythical lands of Scandinavia with The Scandinavian Home: Landscape and Lore at The Frick Pittsburgh.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-The-Scandinavian-Home-Landscape-and-Lore)

Through June 7, 2026

### Catching Sunbeams from the Porch Swing of Wisteria Castle

Explore abstract sculptures by a Atticus Adams in the Frick Pittsburgh's vibrant, flora-filled historic greenhouse.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-Catching-Sunbeams)

### Permanent Collection

In the galleries at The Frick Art Museum you will find fabulous examples of early Renaissance Italian painting; rare French and Flemish tapestries; Renaissance and Baroque bronze statuettes; eighteenth-century French painting, furniture and decorative arts; spectacular Chinese porcelains; and masterpieces by artists such as Rubens, Boucher, Gainsborough, and Fragonard.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-Permanent-Collection)

### Chinese Porcelains from the Collection

This special installation showcases Henry Clay Frick's broad and stunning collection of Chinese porcelains, which once decorated both Clayton and the Fricks' summer estate, Eagle Rock. Frick's collection of porcelains includes several objects previously owned by financier and collector J. P. Morgan as well as a delightful collection of miniature porcelains from the estate of ceramics connoisseur George B. Warren.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-Chinese-Porcelains-from-the-collection)

### From Carriages to Cars

Learn about the profound impact the car had on American life at the Frick Car and Carriage Museum.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-From-Carriages-to-Cars)

### Duquesne SoundWalk at the Frick

Duquesne SoundWalk at the Frick is a new collaboration with students of Duquesne University's Mary Pappert School of Music. The sounds of Frick past come to life through soundscapes, adding a new layer of dimensionality to the museum-going experience!

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-Duquesne-SoundWalk-at-the-Frick)

### Upcoming Exhibitions

February 21, 2026 - May 17, 2026

#### Lewis Hine Pictures America

From Feb. 21 - May 17, 2026, explore the work of Lewis Wickes Hine, the "father of documentary photography," at The Frick Pittsburgh with Lewis Hine Pictures America. Hine's artistic photos exposed the harsh realities faced by immigrants, children, and the working class in their everyday lives during the early decades of the twentieth century.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-Lewis-Hine-Pictures-America)

June 20, 2026 - October 11, 2026

#### French Moderns

From June 20 - Oct. 11, 2026, The Frick Pittsburgh presents French Moderns. A special installation at The Frick Art Museum presents Dutch contemporary artist Bouke de Vries' interpretation of an 18th-century tablescape with a sprawling assemblage of porcelain fragments resembling a nuclear wasteland. ### Edgar Degas: The Private Impressionist: Works on Paper by the Artist and His Circle

This exhibition of more than 100 works on paper is built around a core group of 55 works by Degas, known as one of the strongest draftsmen of the Impressionist circle. From early drawings to late experiments in photography, the exhibition will illuminate the artist's personal life, his creative restlessness and experimentation, and his wider artistic circle.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-Edgar-Degas-The-Private-Impressionist-Works-on-Paper-by-the-Artist-and-His-Circle)

March 1, 2014 - May 25, 2014

#### The Warner Collection: An American Odyssey

This exciting exhibition features American artists from the nation's early years of independence through the dawn of the 20th century and includes major artists and movements from the Peale family and Gilbert Stuart to American Impressionists like Childe Hassam and Theodore Robinson, with beautiful Hudson River School works falling in between.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-The-Warner-Collection-An-American-Odyssey)

July 13, 2014 - October 27, 2014

#### Clayton Days Revisited: A Project by Vik Muniz

In 1999 the Frick collaborated with contemporary artist Vik Muniz on a project that resulted in an exhibition of 65 photographs made on site and in the nearby environs of Pittsburgh. This exhibition marked the Frick's first venture into working with a living artist, and resulted in a significant body of work.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-Clayton-Days-Revisited-A-Project-by-Vik-Muniz)

November 1, 2014 - February 1, 2015

#### Charles Courtney Curran: Seeking the Ideal

Henry Clay Frick purchased Curran's 1890 painting Woman with a Horse and Carriage, which typically hangs in the Clayton library. For this exhibition, our painting will join about 60 others as Curran's work travels to three North American venues (including The Frick Art Museum) in this first critical retrospective of his career since his death in 1942. The exhibition is organized by the Dixon Gallery & Gardens, Memphis, and will be accompanied by a full-color catalogue.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-Charles-Courtney-Curran-Seeking-the-Ideal)

[View All Past Exhibitions](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/past-exhibitions)

#### [2013 Exhibitions](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/exhibitions\#acc-tab_category3_2013)

#### October 6, 2012

### Impressions of Interiors: Gilded Age Paintings by Walter Gay

American artist Walter Gay (1856-1937) specialized in painting views of opulent residential interiors in late-19th and early-20th-century America and Europe. John Singer Sargent, Gay's nearly exact contemporary, is well known for painting the sumptuous clothing and jewels of American society in his fashionable portraits.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-Impressions-of-Interiors-Gilded-Age-Paintings-by-Walter-Gay)

February 23, 2013 - June 16, 2013

#### A Kind of Alchemy: Medieval Persian Ceramics

Produced for both the luxury and middle-class markets, these vessels, bowls, pitchers, and bottles reflect numerous cultural and artistic influences and an aesthetic sensibility that seems startlingly modern.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-A-Kind-of-Alchemy-Medieval-Persian-Ceramics)

[View All Past Exhibitions](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/past-exhibitions)

#### [2012 Exhibitions](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/exhibitions\#acc-tab_category3_2012)

#### October 6, 2012

### Impressions of Interiors: Gilded Age Paintings by Walter Gay

American artist Walter Gay (1856-1937) specialized in painting views of opulent residential interiors in late-19th and early-20th-century America and Europe. John Singer Sargent, Gay's nearly exact contemporary, is well known for painting the sumptuous clothing and jewels of American society in his fashionable portraits.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-Impressions-of-Interiors-Gilded-Age-Paintings-by-Walter-Gay)

title: Inclusion | The Frick Pittsburgh Museums & Gardens
content:
##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

## Inclusion & Accessibility

The Frick Pittsburgh is committed to inclusively serving our community‚Äîvisitors, staff, artists, scholars, educational partners, and neighbors. Core to the mission, the Frick offers authentic experiences with art, history, and nature.

The Frick will work to create an inclusive and enlivened creative space by:

- Featuring a varied¬†representation of art, artifacts, and artists in our galleries with specific focus on those historically marginalized by museums;
- Broadening the scope of historical narratives presented by inviting new voices and engaging multiple perspectives;
- Interpreting inclusive historical narratives relevant in the context of the Frick legacy, Pittsburgh, and the Industrial Age with critical reflection, honesty, and transparency;
- Engaging artists, performers, scholars, and community partners¬†in educational and public programming that explores an array of cultural experiences and intellectual inquiries;
- Addressing the physical, mental, and emotional needs of our audiences, employees, and neighbors;
- Ensuring fairness in employment and advancement and fair¬†compensation and professional development;
- Engaging our staff and board in regular¬†education and self-reflection.

Since completing and assessing our goals for our previous strategic plan, The Frick Pittsburgh will create the next strategic plan in 2025-2026 to build on our work and continue progress in our goals.

The Frick Pittsburgh occupies ancestral lands of the Haudenosaunee, Lenape, Osage, and Shawnee peoples. As a place of history and nature, the Frick recognizes the cultural importance of land and the role of cultural institutions in the formation of collective memory. Displacement and erasure are not just histories for native peoples. Land acknowledgements, like historic sites themselves, are exercises in preservation and reconciliation, engaged with past, present, and future.

[![The Frick Pittsburgh Museums and Gardens Logo](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/User/logo.svg)](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/ "The Frick Pittsburgh Museums and Gardens Logo")

##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

# Donate

[Make A Donation](https://tickets.thefrickpittsburgh.org/MembershipAndDonations.aspx?RegularOnly=True)

When you support the Frick, you enable us to continue to steward and interpret our extraordinary collections, share special works with our community, and preserve an indelible part of Pittsburgh‚Äôs heritage. Your contribution today allows us to continue to serve, educate, and inspire‚Äînow, and for generations to come. Thank you for supporting The Frick Pittsburgh!

The Frick Art & Historical Center is a non-profit 501(c)3 charitable organization. Contributions are tax-deductible as allowed by law. (Tax exempt number 25-1596285.)

### Support the Campaign for Clayton

Clayton is the only remaining intact Gilded Age mansion from Pittsburgh‚Äôs Millionaire's Row. Built in 1870 and recognized on the National Register of Historic Places, this 154-year-old treasure is showing its age. From crumbling bricks and deteriorating mortar to warped wood and 20 layers of old paint ‚Äî¬†Clayton is in desperate need of some tender loving care.

Please join us and help preserve this vital part of Pittsburgh‚Äôs history by contributing to the Campaign for Clayton today!

[Donate to the Campaign](https://give.thefrickpittsburgh.org/campaignforclayton)

## Options for Giving

#### [Membership](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/donate\#acc1-tab1)

Join, renew, or gift a membership today.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/membership)

#### [The Frick Societies](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/donate\#acc1-tab2)

Members of The Frick Societies serve as incomparable champions of arts and culture with philanthropic support for exhibitions, programming, and the care and growth of the Frick‚Äôs diverse collections for all to enjoy.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/the-frick-societies)

#### [Gifts of Stock](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/donate\#acc1-tab3)

Using appreciated stock is an excellent way to make a gift to the Frick because it offers significant tax benefits without affecting your cash flow.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/gifts-of-stock)

#### [Matching Gifts](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/donate\#acc1-tab4)

Many companies will match charitable contributions made by employees and retirees, doubling or tripling the impact of your gift.¬† Contact your employer‚Äôs Human Resources department to find out if it has a matching gift program.¬† Complete and mail the matching gift form along with your contribution, or email [Members@TheFrickPittsburgh.org](mailto:Members@TheFrickPittsburgh.org).

#### [Qualified Charitable Distributions](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/donate\#acc1-tab5)

Qualified charitable distributions from your Individual Retirement Account (IRA) are current gifts with an immediate impact on all that we do here at the Frick.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/qualified-charitable-distributions)

#### [Legacy Planning](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/donate\#acc1-tab6)

The most common form of charitable giving is an outright gift of cash. By exploring a wide range of gift planning opportunities, you can learn how to achieve your personal financial planning goals while making a significant contribution to the Frick.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/LegacyPlanning)

#### Support The Frick Pittsburgh with a gift to our annual fund.

Donate online or call [412-371-0600](tel:412-371-0600).

title: Exhibitions | The Frick Pittsburgh Museums & Gardens
content:
##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

## The Frick Pittsburgh Museums and Gardens

# Exhibitions

The Frick offers an exciting schedule of special exhibitions featuring art and artists from the Renaissance to the present.

Through January 11, 2026

### The Scandinavian Home: Landscape and Lore

From Sept. 27, 2025 - Jan. 11, 2026, escape to the magical, mythical lands of Scandinavia with The Scandinavian Home: Landscape and Lore at The Frick Pittsburgh.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//Exhibition-The-Scandinavian-Home-Landscape-and-Lore)

Through June 7, 2026

### Catching Sunbeams from the Porch Swing of Wisteria Castle

Explore abstract sculptures by a Atticus Adams in the Frick Pittsburgh's vibrant, flora-filled historic greenhouse.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//Exhibition-Catching-Sunbeams)

### Permanent Collection

In the galleries at The Frick Art Museum you will find fabulous examples of early Renaissance Italian painting; rare French and Flemish tapestries; Renaissance and Baroque bronze statuettes; eighteenth-century French painting, furniture and decorative arts; spectacular Chinese porcelains; and masterpieces by artists such as Rubens, Boucher, Gainsborough, and Fragonard.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//Exhibition-Permanent-Collection)

### Chinese Porcelains from the Collection

This special installation showcases Henry Clay Frick's broad and stunning collection of Chinese porcelains, which once decorated both Clayton and the Fricks' summer estate, Eagle Rock. Frick's collection of porcelains includes several objects previously owned by financier and collector J. P. Morgan as well as a delightful collection of miniature porcelains from the estate of ceramics connoisseur George B. Warren.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//Exhibition-Chinese-Porcelains-from-the-collection)

### From Carriages to Cars

Learn about the profound impact the car had on American life at the Frick Car and Carriage Museum.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//Exhibition-From-Carriages-to-Cars)

### Duquesne SoundWalk at the Frick

Duquesne SoundWalk at the Frick is a new collaboration with students of Duquesne University's Mary Pappert School of Music. The sounds of Frick past come to life through soundscapes, adding a new layer of dimensionality to the museum-going experience!

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//Exhibition-Duquesne-SoundWalk-at-the-Frick)

### Upcoming Exhibitions

February 21, 2026 - May 17, 2026

#### Lewis Hine Pictures America

From Feb. 21 - May 17, 2026, explore the work of Lewis Wickes Hine, the "father of documentary photography," at The Frick Pittsburgh with Lewis Hine Pictures America. Hine's artistic photos exposed the harsh realities faced by immigrants, children, and the working class in their everyday lives during the early decades of the twentieth century.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//Exhibition-Lewis-Hine-Pictures-America)

June 20, 2026 - October 11, 2026

#### French Moderns

From June 20 - Oct. 11, 2026, The Frick Pittsburgh presents French Moderns. Encompassing realism, impressionism, post-impressionism, symbolism, Fauvism, cubism and surrealism, French Moderns exemplifies the avant-garde movements that defined modern art in the nineteenth and twentieth centuries and that continue to awe art-goers today.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//Exhibition-French-Moderns)

### Past Exhibitions

#### [2025 Exhibitions](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//exhibitions\#acc-tab_category3_2025)

#### March 1, 2025

### Kara Walker: Harper's Pictorial History of the Civil War (Annotated)

Comprised of 15 large-scale prints, Harper's Pictorial History of the Civil War (Annotated) revisits the historical representations found in the 1862 publication "Harper's Pictorial History of the Civil War" and overlays enlargements of woodcut plates with Kara Walker's silkscreen cutout figures in solid black silhouette. On view at the Frick Art Museum from March 1 through May 25 2025.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//Exhibition-Kara-Walker-Harpers-Pictorial-History-of-the-Civil-War-Annotated)

August 17, 2024 - May 25, 2025

#### Pittsburgh Builds Bridges

Pittsburgh Builds Bridges, an initiative by artist Ebtehal Badawi, promotes connection, inclusion, and compassion through community artmaking and conversation.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//Exhibition-Pittsburgh-Builds-Bridges)

[View All Past Exhibitions](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//past-exhibitions)

#### [2024 Exhibitions](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//exhibitions\#acc-tab_category3_2024)

#### March 17, 2021

### Reckoning: Grief and Light

Back by popular demand! A multisensory installation of sculpture by Artist-in-Residence Vanessa German explores the capacity of museums to function as spaces of public reckoning. Immerse yourself in this meditation on grief, love, and social healing -- a visual elegy to George Floyd, Breonna Taylor, Elijah McClain, and other lives lost at the hands of police, accompanied by symphonic music inspired by the history of Africans enslaved on rice plantations.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//Exhibition-Vanessa-German)

April 1, 2023 - March 10, 2024

#### From Stage to Page: 400 Years of Shakespeare in Print

In partnership with Carnegie Mellon University Libraries, From Stage to Page: 400 Years of Shakespeare in Print celebrates the 400th anniversary of William Shakespeare's First Folio. Free and open to all.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//shakespeare400)

May 6, 2023 - February 4, 2024

#### Pittsburgh and the Great Migration: Black Mobility and the Automobile

Pittsburgh neighborhoods like the Hill District became a haven for Black communities to thrive during the Great Migration (1916-1945). Explore automobile ownership and its effect on the lives of Black Americans in the mid-20th century.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//Exhibition-Pittsburgh-And-The-Great-Migration)

October 7, 2023 - January 28, 2024

#### The Red Dress

**14 Years. 380 Embroiderers. 51 Countries. Millions of stitches. 1 Dress.**

A collaborative embroidery project, The Red Dress was conceived by British artist Kirstie Macleod as an artistic platform for women around the world.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//Exhibition-The-Red-Dress)

November 7, 2023 - May 19, 2024

#### Reckoning: Place and Imagination

Reckoning: Place and Imagination features celebrated American artist, poet, and activist Vanessa German's latest outdoor sculpture, _Of Thee We Sing_.

[View Exhibition](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//Exhibition-Reckoning-Place-and-Imagination)

February 17, 2024 - March 9, 2024

#### Through My Lens: What It's Like to be a Child in My Neighborhood

Through My Lens amplifies the voices of 4th and 5th graders in The Maker's Clubhouse's after-school program as they show what it's like to be a child through the lens of their own cameras.

### The Frick Reflects: Looking Back, Moving Forward

A critical look at The Frick Pittsburgh's permanent collection and institutional origin story, inspired by the 50th anniversary of the founding of The Frick Art Museum and 30th anniversary of Clayton's restoration and public opening, this exhibition examines the social context in which the Frick family lived, the perspective with which Helen Clay Frick founded the organization, and the values and viewpoints the collection reveals, sometimes unwittingly.

#### Bouke de Vries: War and Pieces

A special installation at The Frick Art Museum presents Dutch contemporary artist Bouke de Vries' interpretation of an 18th-century tablescape with a sprawling assemblage of porcelain fragments resembling a nuclear wasteland. A former conservator of art objects, de Vries resurrects broken porcelain shards that would otherwise have been discarded and uses them to create new artworks that tackle both contemporary and historic issues.

##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

# Qualified Charitable Distributions

Qualified charitable distributions from your Individual Retirement Account (IRA) are current gifts with an immediate impact. Often referred to as "IRA Charitable Rollover Gifts," these gifts are distributions paid directly from an IRA to a nonprofit.

If you are 70¬Ω or older, you can transfer as much as $100,000 per year from an IRA directly to the Frick‚Äîwithout counting this transfer as taxable income.

If you were 70¬Ω before January 1, 2020, the qualified charitable distribution counts toward your required minimum distribution (RMD). If you are 70¬Ω after January 1, 2020, you do not have required minimum distribution until age 72. If you do not meet your RMDs, IRA owners face a large tax penalty. This means you would either withdraw those amounts (increasing your taxable income) or donate them as a qualified charitable distribution.

The most common way to make this gift is to submit a request to your IRA custodian. For more information on Qualified Charitable Distributions to the Frick, contact: Advancement & Engagement staff at 412-342-4086 or [Membership@TheFrickPittsburgh.org](mailto:Membership@TheFrickPittsburgh.org).

title: Legacy Planning | The Frick Pittsburgh Museums & Gardens
content:
##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

Donate to the Frick

# Legacy Planning

The Frick Pittsburgh is an exceptional example of a planned gift at its most generous‚ÄîHelen Clay Frick left provisions in her will for Clayton, her childhood family home, to be restored and opened to the public along with The Frick Art Museum and the family‚Äôs car and carriage collection. That foresight has enabled The Frick Pittsburgh to evolve into the unique museum we have today.

You, too, can create a legacy that will help ensure that the Frick continues to serve students and families well into the future. In addition to making a difference in the lives of others, a planned gift can provide tax savings or income benefits for you and your family. There are many ways to make such a gift‚Äîsimple methods include gifts in your will or living trust, gifts of life insurance, gifts of retirement assets, and more.

To make the process of legacy giving easy, The Frick has partnered with FreeWill for our community to create an estate plan for free. **[FreeWill‚Äôs secure online tool empowers you to write a legally valid will or trust in about 20 minutes.](http://www.freewill.com/thefrickpittsburgh?utm_source=partner&utm_medium=website&utm_campaign=202206_thefrickpittsburgh_plannedgivingpg)** As you write your will, FreeWill presents you with the opportunity to make a planned gift to The Frick on your terms.

If you have ‚Äònon-probate‚Äô assets like a life insurance policy that you‚Äôd like to donate, you can **[use this FreeWill tool to log all of these assets and name The Frick as a beneficiary.](http://www.freewill.com/beneficiaries/thefrickpittsburgh?utm_source=partner&utm_medium=website&utm_campaign=202206_thefrickpittsburgh_plannedgivingpg)**

If you have already created a legacy by including a gift in your estate plan, **[will you please complete this form to let us know?](http://www.freewill.com/record/thefrickpittsburgh?utm_source=partner&utm_medium=website&utm_campaign=202206_thefrickpittsburgh_plannedgivingpg)** This helps us update our records and thank you for building a legacy to support The Frick‚Äôs authentic experiences with art, history, and nature.

### Dr. Soumyo Moitra's Story

Dr. Moitra understands the impact that art, history, and nature can have on someone. As a graduate student, Moitra appreciated the ability to come and visit the The Frick Art Museum for free when he didn‚Äôt have many resources. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs so important to have this opportunity, especially if you‚Äôre interested in art but can‚Äôt afford to pay the price of admission,‚Äù Moitra says.

As an adult, Moitra retained his love of art and was compelled to join the Frick as a member, remembering the effect the museums had on him in his younger years. Thinking about his own legacy, he also decided to make a planned gift to the Frick, knowing that his gift would make it possible for future generations of students to visit, as he had.

The Frick has been a key part of Dr. Moitra‚Äôs life for many years, and he feels it is important to give back, support the future of the institution, and ensure that anyone can find sanctuary on our campus. We are so thankful for members like Dr. Moitra, who have a positive impact on everything we do here.

## Legacy Planning

#### [Gifts in Your Will\  Many supporters of The Frick Pittsburgh choose to leave a donation in their wills and trusts.](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/legacyplanning\#acc1-tab1)

Many supporters of The Frick Pittsburgh choose to leave a donation in their wills and trusts to increase their long-term impact, without any upfront cost during their lifetimes

A gift in your will is often the simplest route to your legacy, and to make it as easy as possible, we're giving you a completely free way to write or start your will. **[Click here](http://www.freewill.com/thefrickpittsburgh?utm_source=partner&utm_medium=website&utm_campaign=202206_thefrickpittsburgh_plannedgivingpg) to start the completely free process of writing your legal will.** Including a gift to The Frick Pittsburgh helps to cultivate a community where we share authentic connections with art, history, nature‚Äîand with one another.

This tool is free to you whether you choose to include a gift to The Frick Pittsburgh or not. It can be used to create a fully valid legal will or guide you through planning your will before finding an estate planning attorney near you. FreeWill helps our supporters create plans that enable us to preserve and interpret an indelible part of Pittsburgh's heritage, share renowned works of art with our community, and continue to serve, educate, and inspire‚Äînow, and for generations to come.

**Are you already working with an attorney on your will or living trust? You can complete your gift in as little as one sentence.**

‚ÄúI hereby give to the Frick Art & Historical Center, a nonprofit located in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, with a business address of 7227 Reynolds Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15208, and with a tax identification number of 25-1596285, the sum of \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ dollars (all or \_\_\_\_\_\_ percent of my estate) for its general purposes."

By including the Frick in your will or living trust, you play an important part in ensuring the continuation of the museum‚Äôs mission long into the future.

#### [Beneficiary Designations\  Name the Frick as a beneficiary of your retirement plan, life insurance policy, or commercial annuity](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/legacyplanning\#acc1-tab2)

While some prefer to leave a gift in their wills or estates, others appreciate the increased flexibility of a beneficiary designation. You might consider using:

- IRAs and retirement plans
- Life insurance policies
- Commercial annuities

It only takes three simple steps to name The Frick Pittsburgh as a beneficiary:

1. Contact your retirement plan administrator, insurance company, bank, or financial institution for a change-of-beneficiary form.
2. Decide what percentage (1 to 100) you would like The Frick Pittsburgh to receive and name us, along with the percentage you choose.
3. Return the completed form to your plan administrator, insurance company, bank, or financial institution.

Thank you for considering The Frick Pittsburgh to be the recipient of these gifts from the heart. It‚Äôs truly an honor to be included in the legacy of someone who cares so deeply about providing accessible cultural assets in the Pittsburgh region.

#### [Information for Professional Advisors\  Help us fulfill your client's wishes](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/legacyplanning\#acc1-tab3)

To direct a gift to the Frick or for help in making one:

Legal Name: Frick Art & Historical Center, Inc.

Address: 7227 Reynolds Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15208

Federal Tax ID Number: 25-1596285

Contact: Pat Winter, Interim Director of Advancement & Engagement, at 412-342-4079 or [winterp@thefrickpittsburgh.org](mailto:winterp@thefrickpittsburgh.org?subject=Making%20a%20planned%20gift%20to%20The%20Frick%20Pittsburgh)

content:
##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

Join & Support

# Reciprocal Museums

Frick Pittsburgh members at the Family¬†($100) level and above can experience more than 1,400 museums across North America with reciprocal museum benefits.

Members will enjoy free general admission, discounts at museum shops and restaurants as well as on concert tickets and lecture registrations\* through the [North American Reciprocal Museum (NARM) Association](https://narmassociation.org/) and the [Reciprocal Organization of Associated Museums (ROAM)](https://sites.google.com/site/roammuseums/home/list-of-roam-museums) reciprocal programs, in addition to the Art Museum Reciprocal Network museums listed below.

_\*Reciprocal benefits vary by organization.¬† Please contact the organization(s) you plan to visit to verify the benefits offered to reciprocal members._

## Art Museum Reciprocal Network

[Academy Art Museum](https://academyartmuseum.org/) ‚Äì Easton, MD

[Albright-Knox Art Gallery](https://www.albrightknox.org/)‚Äì Buffalo, NY

[American Folk Art Museum](https://folkartmuseum.org/) ‚Äì Long Island City, NY

[Art Gallery of Ontario](https://ago.ca/) ‚Äì Toronto, Ontario (Canada)

[The Barnes Foundation](https://www.barnesfoundation.org/)¬†‚Äì¬†Philadelphia, PA

[Blanton Museum of Art](https://blantonmuseum.org/) ‚Äì Austin, TX

[Chrysler Museum of Art](http://www.chrysler.org/)‚Äì Norfolk, VA

[The Cleveland Museum of Art](http://www.clevelandart.org/)‚Äì Cleveland, OH

[Columbus Museum of Art](https://www.columbusmuseum.org/) ‚Äì Columbus, OH

[Cooper Hewitt, Smithsonian Design Museum](https://www.cooperhewitt.org/) ‚Äì New York, NY

[Crocker Art Museum](https://www.crockerart.org/) ‚Äì Sacramento, CA

[Delaware Art Museum](http://www.delart.org/) ‚Äì Wilmington, DE

[Denver Art Museum](https://www.denverartmuseum.org/en) ‚Äì Denver, CO

[Des Moines Art Center](https://www.desmoinesartcenter.org/)¬†‚Äì Des Moines, IA

##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

## Plan Your Visit

# Ready to explore?

At The Frick Pittsburgh, get ready to experience art, history, and nature.

To ensure you enjoy as much as possible during your visit, check our **[calendar](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar)**¬†for all offerings and get your tickets in advance. Clayton tours are limited and do sell out!

For the best experience, begin your visit at Grable Visitor Center. A Museum Experience Associate will orient you to our campus and help you purchase day-of tickets, if available.

[Tickets](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/tickets)

Visit

## Hours & Admission

Admission to the gardens, permanent collection of The Frick Art Museum, and a section of the Car and Carriage Museum is always free.

Admission fees apply to¬†certain special¬†exhibitions in The Frick Art Museum, Car and Carriage Museum, and to Clayton tours.

Clayton tours do sell out and advanced purchase is¬†strongly recommended.

**Tuesday - Sunday**

8:00 AM - 8:00 PM

_Gardens and Grounds_

9:30 AM - 3:00 PM

_The Caf√© at the Frick_

10 AM - 5:00 PM

_Grable Visitor Center, The Frick Art Museum, Car and Carriage Museum, Greenhouse, Frick Museum Store_

10:15 AM - 3:00 PM

_Clayton Tours_

**Monday**

Closed

[Current Exhibitions](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/exhibitions) [Tickets](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/tickets)

Closed for New Year's Day, Easter, Memorial Day, Juneteenth, Independence Day, Labor Day, Indigenous Peoples' Day, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day

[Download visitor map](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/TheFrickPittsburghSiteMap2022.pdf?d=2022727165656)

SEE & DO

3:00 PM - 4:00 PM

6:30 PM - 8:00 PM

[Experience Add-On: Post-Performance Reception for _Master of the House_ Film Screening](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//Event-Experience-Add-On-Post-Performance-Reception-for-Master-of-the-House-Film-Screening)

[View All](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar)

Getting Here

## Directions to the Frick

The Frick is approximately 20 minutes east of downtown Pittsburgh at the corner of Penn and South Homewood avenues in Point Breeze. The entrance is located on Reynolds Street where parking is available in our free lot.

From downtown Pittsburgh, the Pittsburgh Airport or PA Turnpike, the Frick is reached via the Parkway East (I-376). Exit at #77‚ÄìEdgewood Swissvale (take the Edgewood ramp), follow Braddock Ave. to Penn Ave. and turn left. Continue four blocks and turn left on South Homewood Ave. Proceed one long block to traffic circle (Reynolds St.) and follow signs to parking lot entrance.

**PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION**

Pittsburgh Regional Transit buses 67, 69,¬†and 71C\* provide service from downtown Pittsburgh.

_\*Starting October 1, 2023, the 71C will terminate in Oakland and no longer serve Uptown and downtown Pittsburgh. Please plan accordingly. [Learn more about the schedule changes on Pittsburgh Regional Transit's website](https://www.rideprt.org/schedules/Service-adjustments/)._

[Get Directions](https://www.google.com/maps?ll=40.446587,-79.902277&z=17&t=m&hl=en-US&gl=IN&mapclient=embed&cid=17850738363559558322) [Public Transportation](https://www.rideprt.org/)

Plan Ahead

content:
##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

# Group Visits

Make your next group outing special at the Frick. Our customized tour packages ensure that your group gets the most out of their Frick experience.

### Group Tours

We offer a variety of group tours and experiences. Please contact us to customize your package and for special group rates.

**Group tour requests must be made at least six weeks in advance.**

[Email us now](mailto:education@thefrickpittsburgh.org?subject=Group%20Visit)

**If you plan to visit the Frick as a self-guided group, please review our museum guidelines for self-guided groups ahead of your arrival.**

[View Adult Group Guidelines](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/Museum%2DGuidelines%2Dfor%2DSelf%2DGuided%2DGroups%2Devergreen%2D2025.pdf?d=20254493238) [View Student Group Guidelines](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/Museum%2DGuidelines%2Dfor%2DSelf%2DGuided%2DStudent%2DGroups%2Devergreen%2D2025.pdf?d=20254493241)

#### [Group Tours of Clayton](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/groupvisits\#acc-tab1)

All large groups are divided into subgroups of 8 to 10, which depart at 10-minute intervals to begin the tour.

When groups are not touring Clayton, they may visit The Frick Art Museum, Car and Carriage Museum, Grable Visitor Center, Greenhouse, or Museum Store.

Available for groups of 11 to 30, Tuesday through Friday.

COST: $24 per person

Payment in full is required one month before your visit.

Reservations required.¬†Contact 412-342-4087 or email [education@thefrickpittsburgh.org](mailto:education@thefrickpittsburgh.org)

#### [Group Tours of the Frick Art Museum](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/groupvisits\#acc-tab2)

**The Scandinavian Home: Landscape and Lore**

_September¬†27, 2025 ‚Äì January 11, 2026_

Guided group tours of [Scandinavian Home](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-The-Scandinavian-Home-Landscape-and-Lore) are available for groups of 8-20 people. Guided group tours are scheduled based on availability.

Available for groups of 8 to 20, Tuesday through Friday.

COST: $20 per person

Payment in full is required one month before your visit.

Reservations required.¬†Contact¬†[education@thefrickpittsburgh.org](mailto:education@thefrickpittsburgh.org)¬†to reserve.

#### [Group Tours of the Car and Carriage Museum](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/groupvisits\#acc-tab3)

Guided tours of the Car and Carriage Museum explore America's transition from carriage to car through the Frick Pittsburgh's collection of 19th-century carriages and early automobiles. Groups of ten or more people interested in a guided tour of the museum are encouraged to reserve a private group tour.

Available for groups of 10 to 20, Tuesday through Friday.

COST: $7 per person

Payment in full is required one month before your visit.

Reservations required. Contact 412-342-4087 or email [education@thefrickpittsburgh.org](mailto:education@thefrickpittsburgh.org).

When should I make my reservation? Where may we park our bus? How much time should we allow for touring...

##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

Join & Support

# Membership

You can make a difference.¬†The Frick depends on our members and donors to help us continue to offer vibrant cultural programming to our region.¬†Thanks to you, we can continue to be a place where audiences of all ages can discover the art, history, and nature that make the Frick such a special place.¬†Members are provided with enhanced opportunities to enjoy all that the Frick has to offer through free admission, discounts, events, and much more.¬†And now, you are able to make a virtual visit to the Frick at any time through our [online experiences and activities](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/virtual).

_Questions about Membership? Having trouble reserving a ticket on our website? Please call the MEMBERS HOTLINE at 412-342-4086._

[Frequently Asked Questions](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/MembershipFAQ)

### Benefits for All

- FREE admission to The Frick Art Museum, the Car and Carriage Museum, tours of Clayton,¬†and all touring exhibitions (timed tickets¬†recommended)
- FREE or discounted registration for exciting programs, including virtual programs, expert panel discussions, author talks, workshops, and more
- Invitations to exclusive member-only events and previews.
- 10% discount at The Caf√© at the Frick\*
- 10% discount¬†in the¬†Frick Museum Store, plus invitations to extra discount days
- All members receive E-newsletters and updates about programming¬†and special events

content:
##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

##### Help preserve our past and shape the future.

# Support The Frick Pittsburgh

When you make a gift to The Frick Pittsburgh, you play an essential role in our mission to continue the legacy of Helen Clay Frick by offering one of the best experiences of art, history¬†and nature in a welcoming environment that inspires and delights.

Discover the many ways that your gift to the Frick builds a lasting legacy.¬† Whether you‚Äôre interested in supporting a specific exhibition or program, becoming an Individual or Corporate Member, making an Annual Fund gift or including us in your estate plans, know that your gift helps us to inspire and educate audiences of all ages through world-class exhibitions, meaningful educational programming and continued care of our museum and gardens.

### Membership

Enjoy the benefits of membership‚Äîfree admission, exclusive member events, discounts and more. Members experience more of what makes the Frick a remarkable institution.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/membership)

#### Levels & Benefits

Experience the Frick the best way possible‚Äîas a member! Join or renew your membership online today.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/membership#ben)

#### The Frick Societies

By joining The Frick Societies, you are making a philanthropic gift that supports our mission and connects you with like-minded art and cultural enthusiasts through exclusive, behind-the-scenes experiences.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/the-frick-societies)

#### Gift of Membership

Give the gift of membership and share our exceptional collections with your friends and loved ones.

[Learn More](https://tickets.thefrickpittsburgh.org/MembershipAndDonations.aspx?MembershipOnly=True&MemberLevel=126&Gift=True)

#### Reciprocal Museums

Like to travel? Members at the Fellow level and above receive free admission to more than 800 museums across North America with reciprocal museum benefits.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/reciprocal-museums)

### The Frick Societies

Be part of an exclusive group that influences the future of the Frick and helps maintain it as a cultural institution of the highest caliber for future generations.¬† Membership in The Frick Societies is available with a combined annual gift of $1,000 or more.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/the-frick-societies)

#### Levels & Benefits

The Frick Societies were created to recognize your exceptional support of our mission with access to behind-the-scenes experiences, social events, and much more!

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/the-frick-societies#core)

### Donate

With your fully tax-deductible donation to the Frick, your gift ensures that we can showcase world-class exhibitions, engage and educate audiences of all ages, and preserve and expand our permanent collection.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/donate)

#### Donate

Your Annual Fund gift, in any amount, makes a measurable¬†difference.¬† Donate online today.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/donate)

#### Matching Gifts

You may be able to double or even triple your support by having your employer match your gift.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/donate#match)

#### Gifts of Stock

Using appreciated stock is an excellent way to give to the Frick. Donating stock offers tax benefits without affecting your cash flow.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/gifts-of-stock)

### Legacy Planning

Learn how you can create an enduring legacy that will help the Frick remain a vibrant cultural institution and receive personal tax and income benefits at the same time.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/LegacyPlanning)

#### Beneficiary Designations

Name the Frick as a beneficiary of your retirement plan, life insurance policy, or commercial annuity in just three simple steps.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/LegacyPlanning)

#### A Gift in Your Will

Perhaps the simplest and most direct way of providing for the Frick is in your estate plans and by remembering the Frick in your will.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/LegacyPlanning)

### Corporate Giving

Receive public recognition and build community goodwill by partnering with the Frick. Opportunities to get involved include a variety of Sponsorships, Corporate Membership, and the Educational Improvement Tax Credit Program (EITC).

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/corporate-giving)

#### Sponsorship

Achieve your marketing, promotional, and client engagement objectives through sponsorship of our exhibitions, education programs and events.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/corporate-giving)

#### EITC

Through Pennsylvania‚Äôs Educational Improvement Tax Credit Program, your contribution supports access to educational programs at the Frick.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/eitc)

#### Our Supporters

We gratefully acknowledge our corporate supporters for investing so generously in the Frick.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/oursupporters)

Support the Frick with a Gift to our Annual Fund Today!

### Donate Now

[![The Frick Pittsburgh Museums and Gardens Logo](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/User/logo.svg)](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/ "The Frick Pittsburgh Museums and Gardens Logo")

title: Accessibility | The Frick Pittsburgh Museums & Gardens
content:
##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

# Accessibility

The Frick welcomes all visitors and strives to provide the best possible experience for everyone who visits the site. If you have questions about accessibility or navigating the site that are not addressed below please contact us at 412-371-0600 or by email at [info@TheFrickPittsburgh.org.](mailto:info@thefrickpittsburgh.org)

### Parking

ADA compliant parking is available in our Reynolds Street parking lot both near The Frick Art Museum and the Grable Visitors' Center.

### Navigating the Site

Visiting the various museums on site requires moving from building to building throughout our 10-acre campus. (View a site map [here](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/Linked%20PDFs/MapofTheFrickPittsburgh011020.pdf).) Tours of Clayton require walking from the Grable Visitor Center to Clayton, where a lift is available for first floor access.

- Grable Visitor Center to The Frick Art Museum: estimated walk time 2 ‚Äì 4 minutes
- Grable Visitor Center to Education Center: estimated walk time 1 minute
- Grable Visitor Center to Car and Carriage Museum: estimated walk time 1 minute
- Grable Visitor Center to The Caf√© at The Frick:¬† estimated walk time 1 ‚Äì 2 minutes
- Grable Visitor Center to Greenhouse : estimated walk time 1 ‚Äì 2 minutes
- Grable Visitor Center to Clayton:¬† estimated walk time 3 ‚Äì 5 minutes

### Wheelchairs and Motorized Scooters

A drop off area for wheelchairs is located along Homewood Avenue, near the Car and Carriage Museum.

Wheelchair accessible buildings include The Frick Art Museum, the Caf√©, the Car and Carriage Museum, the Grable Visitor Center, the Education Center, and the first floor of Clayton.¬†We also welcome personal wheelchairs, walkers, and motorized scooters. Please note that motorized scooters greater than 30" wide cannot navigate the doorways of Clayton. A narrated video tour of Clayton‚Äôs second floor is provided for visitors unable to visit the second floor.

Wheelchairs are available for visitor use on a first-come, first-served basis at the Grable Visitor Center, The Frick Art Museum and the Car and Carriage Museum.

### Restrooms

Accessible restrooms are available in the Grable Visitor Center, The Frick Art Museum, the Car and Carriage Museum and the Education Center.¬†Restrooms are not available in Clayton.

Private all gender restrooms are located in the Grable Visitor Center, the Education Center, and the Caf√©. Opened in April of 2024, the Frick Art Museum now features an¬†Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)-compliant restroom ‚Äî an all-gender accessible family space intended to better serve Frick visitors of all ages, identities, and abilities

### Doors

Power-assist doors can be found at the Frick Art Museum, the Grable Visitor Center, the Car and Carriage Museum, and the Community Room.

### Families

![Photo of the Scott Family Infant Care Room with a large, comfy yellow chair, warm lighting, and amenities for caretakers and children](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/Infant-Care-Room_250-min.png) **The Scott Family Infant Care Room**

New at the Frick, the Scott Family Infant Care Room was designed as a space for caregivers to tend to their young children during their visit in comfort and privacy. Located in the Grable Visitor Center, the Scott Family Infant Care Room is decorated cheerfully with custom wallpaper designed by local artist Clinton van Gemert, and features a cozy armchair, white noise machine, changing table, and toys for little ones to enjoy.

Baby changing stations are located in the Grable Visitor Center, The Frick Art Museum and the Car and Carriage Museum.

Strollers are welcome in all buildings on site except Clayton.

### Service Animals

Service animals are permitted in all public areas of the museum.¬†Service animals are trained to perform specific tasks for an individual with a disability as defined by the Americans with Disabilities Act.¬†Comfort animals, therapy animals, companion animals, or emotional support animals are not service animals as defined by the ADA and are¬†not allowed.¬†The ADA guidelines regarding service animals can be accessed [here.](https://www.ada.gov/service_animals_2010.htm)

### Aides

Professional aides accompanying visitors are admitted to Clayton and to ticketed exhibitions at no charge (one aide per guest). To make a reservation for a professional aide, please call us at 412-371-0600 in advance of your visit.

### Sign Language

American Sign Language interpreters are available at no charge for tours and programs with advance notice to ensure availability. Requests for an ASL interpreter must be made at least two weeks in advance of the date of the visit by contacting Dalena Collins, Learning and Interpretive Coordinator, at 412-342-4087 or [dcollins@thefrickpittsburgh.org](mailto:dcollins@thefrickpittsburgh.org).¬† Payment for the tour or program must be made in advance.

### Large Print

Large print labels are available for visitors to special exhibitions.¬† Labels can be requested at the admissions desk in The Frick Art Museum.

### Membership

The Frick offers an ADA Membership for $30 per year for one person and one aide. For a full list of benefits or to join, visit our Membership page [here](https://thefrickpittsburgh.org/membership)¬†or call the membership office at 412-342-4086 or [email us](mailto:membership@thefrickpittsburgh.org?subject=ADA%20Membership%20%7C%20Website%20Inquiry).

#### Accessibility Coordinator

The Frick‚Äôs accessibility coordinator is Ashley Legg, Director of Enterprise & Visitor Services.¬†She can be reached at [alegg@thefrickpittsburgh.org](mailto:alegg@thefrickpittsburgh.org) or 412-342-4064.

title: Tours | The Frick Pittsburgh Museums & Gardens
content:
##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

# Tours

Experience art, history, and nature on a guided tour.

#### [Clayton Tours](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/tours\#acc-tab1)

### Gilded, Not Golden

_2025 Gilded, Not Golden tours run through Sunday, November 9_

Immerse yourself in 1892, a pivotal year for our nation, Pittsburgh, and the Frick family. [Learn more about the Gilded, Not Golden tour](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Clayton).

[SCHEDULE A TOUR](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Signature-Clayton-Tour-Experience-Gilded-Not-Golden)

_"Our tour guide was excellent! Her knowledge and command of the history was excellent. It was clear that she has a love of her job. That's engaging. We had a youngster (about 10 - 12 years old) in our group. He was very bright and was not shy. Our guide did an excellent job of responding to him while not losing track of her objective. She integrated his quizzical mind into the interaction. It was actually amusing to the entire group. I really appreciate the efforts that the museum put into the development of the new tours." - William S._

### Clayton Preservation Tour

_2025 Preservation Tours Run through Saturday, November 1_

Explore Clayton's evolution from a family home to a public museum on this specialty preservation tour.

[SCHEDULE A TOUR](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Clayton-Preservation-Tour)

### Home for the Holidays at Clayton

_Home For The Holidays tours run from Saturday, November 22 through Sunday, January 4_

Celebrate the season and take in the cheerful atmosphere of a home decked for the holidays on a specialty tour of Clayton!

[SCHEDULE A TOUR](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Home-for-the-Holidays-at-Clayton)

### VIP Private Clayton Tour

**Dates:** Available Tuesday-Friday

**Duration:** 2 hours

**Location:** Clayton

**Cost:** $1,500

**Capacity:** Up to 6 people

Get exclusive access to Clayton for a fully customized private tour catered to your interests, including behind-the-scenes access to objects rarely on view.

Advanced reservation is required; based on staff availability. Payment in full is required one month before your visit. Contact 412-342-4087 or email [education@thefrickpittsburgh.org](http://mailto:education@thefrickpittsburgh.org/).

#### [Frick Art Museum Tours](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/tours\#acc-tab2)

### Guided Tours of _The Scandinavian Home: Landscape and Lore_

**Dates:**¬†Wednesdays, Fridays, and Saturdays

**Time:** 1:00 p.m. and 2:30 p.m.

**Duration:** Approximately one hour

**Location:** The Frick Art Museum

**Cost:** Free with [exhibition admission](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-The-Scandinavian-Home-Landscape-and-Lore)

Join a guided tour of [_**The Scandinavian Home**_](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Exhibition-The-Scandinavian-Home-Landscape-and-Lore) to explore the art, culture and identity of Scandinavia. Exhibition admission is required. Tour participants can¬†meet their gallery facilitator in the rotunda of the Frick Art Museum.

For groups of eight to twenty people, please email [Education@thefrickpittsburgh.org](http://mailto:Education@thefrickpittsburgh.org/) to reserve a guided tour. Guided group tours of the exhibition are scheduled based on availability at a cost of $20¬†per person.

#### [Car and Carriage Museum Tours](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/tours\#acc-tab3)

### Guided Tours of the Car and Carriage Museum

**Dates:** Saturdays

**Time:** 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.

**Duration:** Approximately one hour

**Location:** The Car and Carriage Museum

**Cost:** Free

Join a guided tour of the Car and Carriage Museum and discover the impact of a transportation revolution as you explore the story of America's transition from carriage to car.

Tour participation is free and registration is not required. Meet your guide at the entrance to the Car and Carriage Museum.

For groups of ten or more people, please email [Education@thefrickpittsburgh.org](mailto:Education@thefrickpittsburgh.org) for information about a guided group tour.
