title: Collection | The Frick Pittsburgh Museums & Gardens
content:
##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

# Our Collection

Welcome to our online collections. We are pleased to offer multiple opportunities to explore the objects in our collection. Browse our collection categories below to search our detailed database or enjoy an interactive experience through Google Arts & Culture.

#### Collection Highlights

#### Collection Highlights ‚Äî Google Arts & Culture                                       [By The Frick Pittsburgh](https://artsandculture.google.com/partner/the-frick-pittsburgh)      \# Collection Highlights    \#\# Take a closer look at 11 masterpieces from The Frick Pittsburgh.    Read                                         Landscape with River (1880/1880) by George Hetzel **The Frick Pittsburgh**                                George Hetzel was one of the most popular and well-known painters to work in the Pittsburgh region in the late 19th century. This painting, bought in 1881, is the earliest recorded purchase of a work of art by Henry Clay Frick.                Hetzel's intimate and meditative views of nature are characteristic of works by the Scalp Level School, a group of Pittsburgh-based artists who gathered annually at a mountain retreat near Johnstown, Pennsylvania to sketch and paint the surrounding wilderness.                                                Banks of the Seine at Lavacourt (Bords de la Seine a Lavacourt) (1879/1879) by Claude Monet **The Frick Pittsburgh**                                This painting, which hangs in the sitting room at Clayton, illustrates typical qualities of an Impressionist work:                active, visible brushstrokes, an interest in capturing light effects, and a much brighter palette than was typical of Salon painting at the time.                                                        Still Life (1890/1890) by William Michael Harnett **The Frick Pittsburgh**                                Probably the finest American painting at Clayton, this modest trompe l‚Äôoeil still life measures less than eight by ten inches. The French expression trompe l‚Äôoeil means to ‚Äúfool the eye‚Äù and it is used to describe a style of extreme illusionism in painting.                Harnett, made a name for himself as the quintessential American trompe l‚Äôoeil painter. It is said that when his paintings were publicly exhibited, guards were required to prevent onlookers from trying to remove objects from the painting.                                                Still Life with Fruit (1769/1769) by Jan van Os **The Frick Pittsburgh**                                This richly detailed composition is a fine example of Netherlandish still-life painting.     Purchased by Henry Clay Frick in 1896, it marks Frick‚Äôs first venture into collecting old masters.                The assortment of spring flowers and late summer fruit depicted could never have existed as seen here. Van Os created imaginary arrangements based on watercolor studies he made of each specimen in season.                In this painting, even the smallest objects‚Äîinsects, snails, and water droplets‚Äîare perfectly delineated.                                                The Virgin of Humility Crowned by Two Angels (early 1440s) by Stefano di Giovanni called Sassetta **The Frick Pittsburgh**                                One of the most important figures of Sienese painting, Sassetta combined the stylized figures and rich ornamentation of the Gothic style with the naturalism of the budding Florentine Renaissance.                For example, while surrounded by a field of heavenly gold, the elegant, sinuous Madonna sits on a cushion placed on a tile floor rendered in perspective to create a sense of space.                The faces and gestures of the Madonna and child also portray a more natural solemn tenderness.                                                Nativity (c. 1426-1440) by Giovanni di Paolo **The Frick Pittsburgh**                                Giovanni di Paolo was a master of the Sienese tradition of decorative and precious painting. While many of his Renaissance contemporaries favored a more realistic rendering of spatial relationships, employing accurate linear perspective, he opted for a curving, narrative composition, loaded with religious symbols.                Giovanni's training as a miniaturist is reflected in exquisite details, like the fruit trees, and the meticulously painted peacock.                                                Madonna and Child with St. Elizabeth and St. John (1523/1530) by Bacchiacca **The Frick Pittsburgh**                                The use of vibrant, saturated colors in this composition clearly indicate that Bacchiacca was aware of the development of Mannerism, a late-Renaissance style characterized by a move away from realism towards stylish and artful exaggeration.                The Florentine artist is cleverly quoting from paintings by the most important artists of the time--the head of the Madonna is very similar to those of Leonardo da Vinci, and Saint Elizabeth is modeled after a figure by Andrea del Sarto.                                                Rest on the Flight into Egypt (c. 1509-1520) by Unknown **The Frick Pittsburgh**                                This tapestry is a rare example of an intact devotional weaving, used as a mobile altar. It is composed very much like a painting, with a naturalistic landscape and figures framed by a decorative border.                It is of exceptional qualilty, made with the finest materials‚Äîincluding gold and silver threads. The cost of materials and the months of labor required made tapestries more expensive than paintings and a status symbol demanded by kings and popes.                The composition is filled with meticulous, naturalistic details‚Äîbotanically correct rendering of foliage, and irises, a diving duck, frog, and heron.                                                The Blessing (Le B√©n√©dicit√©) (early 1600s) by Antoine Le Nain **The Frick Pittsburgh**                                Although executed in miniature, the figures in Antoine Le Nain‚Äôs Le B√©n√©dicit√©, are full of life, their faces are individually characterized, expressive with a range of feeling.                The direct gaze and wonderful smile of the boy on the right imbues the whole composition with a feeling of affection and immediacy.    With his toothy grin, he is one of the most memorable and carefully rendered figures associated with this artist, whose figures were normally more subdued.                                                Pastorale: A Peasant Boy Fishing (1732/1732) by Fran√ßois Boucher **The Frick Pittsburgh**                                Boucher was a young man at the start of an illustrious career when he painted this pastoral‚Äîa romanticized vision of country life, in which a peasant couple, full of the bloom of youth, relax and flirt in an idealized landscape.                The painting fully reveals all the freshness of Boucher's brushwork, his mastery of textures, whether it be in the straws of the basket, the foliage of the trees, the softness of the fabric, or the airy matter of the clouds.                      Credits: All media    The story featured may in some cases have been created by an independent third party and may not always represent the views of the institutions, listed below, who have supplied the content.    [The Frick Pittsburgh](https://artsandculture.google.com/partner/the-frick-pittsburgh "The Frick Pittsburgh")                                                      [Discover more on Google Arts & Culture](https://artsandculture.google.com/ "Discover more on Google Arts & Culture")

[Our Collection on Google Arts & Culture](https://www.google.com/culturalinstitute/beta/partner/the-frick-pittsburgh "Our Collection on Google Arts & Culture")

## Explore the Frick's Collection

#### Choose a category below, or [click here to view all](https://collection.thefrickpittsburgh.org/explore-the-collection) [.](https://collection.thefrickpittsburgh.org/explore-the-collection)

We continue to actively create new online exhibitions and provide access to a broader spectrum of our collection. Objects will be added as records are completed and images become available. Please get in touch with us if you are looking for information on an object that is not included here.

[![](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/Frick%5FCollections%28300x225%29%5FC%5FPAINTINGS.jpg)![](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/collection-cars-carriages.png?d=2025879173)](https://collection.thefrickpittsburgh.org/objects?query=object_type%3A%22Carriage%22+OR+object_type%3A%22Cars+and+Carriages%22&limit=40)[![](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/Frick%5FCollections%28300x225%29%5FC%5FDECARTS.jpg)](https://collection.thefrickpittsburgh.org/objects?query=object_type%3A%22Decorative+Arts%22&limit=40)[![](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/collection-costumes.png?d=2025879175)](https://collection.thefrickpittsburgh.org/objects?query=object_type%3A%22Costume%22&limit=40)[![](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/collection-decorative-arts.png?d=2025879178)](https://collection.thefrickpittsburgh.org/objects?query=object_type%3A%22Decorative+Arts%22&limit=40)[![](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/Frick%5FCollections%28300x225%29%5FC%5FPRINTSDRAWINGS.jpg)](https://collection.thefrickpittsburgh.org/objects?query=object_type%3A%22Works+on+Paper%2FDrawing%22+OR+object_type%3A%22Works+on+Paper%2FPrint%22&limit=40)

[![](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/Frick%5FCollections%28300x225%29%5FC%5FCARS.jpg)![](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/collection-paintings.png?d=20258791711)](https://collection.thefrickpittsburgh.org/objects?query=object_type%3A%22Painting%22&limit=40)[![](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/Frick%5FCollections%28300x225%29%5FC%5FCOSTUMES.jpg)![](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/collection-photographs.png?d=20258791714)](https://collection.thefrickpittsburgh.org/objects?query=object_type%3A%22Photography%22&limit=40)[![](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/Frick%5FCollections%28300x225%29%5FC%5FPHOTOGRAPHS.jpg)![](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/collection-prints-drawings.png?d=20258791716)](https://collection.thefrickpittsburgh.org/objects?query=object_type%3A%22Works+on+Paper%2FDrawing%22+OR+object_type%3A%22Works+on+Paper%2FPrint%22&limit=40)

content:
##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

Donate to the Frick

# Corporate Giving

Extend your reach to new customers, receive public recognition, and build community goodwill through sponsorship at the Frick.¬† The options listed below provide promotional opportunities for your company to benefit from name placement in front of a premium audience.¬† Build your brand, receive valuable recognition, and support great events and educational programming for our community.¬†Contact Manager of Institutional Support Jodi Golomb for details at 412-342-4089 or [JGolomb@TheFrickPittsburgh.org](mailto:JGolomb@TheFrickPittsburgh.org).

## Be a Corporate Sponsor

#### [Exhibition Sponsorship](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/corporate-giving\#acc1-tab1)

Sponsors play an important role in supporting the Frick‚Äôs exhibitions and bringing important artwork to Pittsburgh.¬† Exhibition Sponsors are recognized in many highly visible ways, enhancing their profile and demonstrating their commitment to the arts.

**Exhibition Sponsors receive benefits such as the following:**

- Name and Logo Recognition on select signage and advertising
- Name and Logo Recognition at the event and on website, social media, and event listings
- Complimentary Invitations to the Exhibition Opening
- Opportunity to host a private event ‚Äì perfect for client entertaining or your next employee event ( _note: catering and all other rentals are the responsibility of the sponsor_)

**UPCOMING EXHIBITIONS**

[View Exhibitions](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/exhibitions) [View Exhibition Events](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar?search=1&page=1&search_type=1)

#### [Event Sponsorship](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/corporate-giving\#acc1-tab2)

Throughout the year, the Frick hosts a variety of exciting events.¬† Event sponsors support popular programming and receive valuable recognition from key audiences.

**Event Sponsors receive benefits such as the following:**

- Name and Logo Recognition at the event and on website, social media, and event listings
- Social Media Co-Host Privileges
- Complimentary Tickets to the event
- Opportunity to set up a table at the event to distribute information about your company, promote your business, and give away branded materials

**See upcoming events available for sponsorship.**

[View Events](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar?search=1&page=1)

#### [Education Sponsorship](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/corporate-giving\#acc1-tab3)

The Frick offers a variety of opportunities to support education programs for all ages.¬†Supporting programs at the Frick is a great way to demonstrate your company‚Äôs commitment to education.

- Name and Logo Recognition at the event and on website, social media, and event listings
- Name Recognition on all printed material for the program

- Time Travel, during which kids add to a giant walk-through time machine and make their own prehistoric paint
- Circus, with three rings of role play and the creation of costumes and critters;

_Second Saturday Studios_¬†\-\- This family-friendly arts programming encourages children and their families to make art together.¬† Families with children of all ages are invited to explore different and unusual materials or find fresh new ways to use familiar paper, paint and pencils.¬† This free, drop-in program is held in the new Education Center.

Examples of typical programming:

- Create, collect and exchange one-of-a-kind artist trading cards.
- Emboss, color and shape our fancy foils.
- Use a plethora of paper on a paper exploration.
- Go natural using trees, leaves, and rocks for special outdoor art.

EITC is another great way to support Education at the Frick.

[Learn more about EITC](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/eitc)

[![The Frick Pittsburgh Museums and Gardens Logo](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/User/logo.svg)](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/ "The Frick Pittsburgh Museums and Gardens Logo")

title: The Frick Societies | The Frick Pittsburgh Museums & Gardens
content:
##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

Join & Support

# The Frick Societies

Be a part of a special group that plays an incomparable role in sustaining the Frick and shaping an inspiring future fueled by curiosity, equity, and inclusion!

Combined annual giving of $1,000 or more will enable you to become a member of this leadership group as well as provide vital ongoing philanthropic support for exhibitions, programming, and the care and growth of the Frick‚Äôs diverse collections for all to enjoy.

There are many simple and creative ways to support the Frick at this level. You can [make a gift online](https://tickets.thefrickpittsburgh.org/membershipanddonations.aspx?MemberLevel=126) today¬†or mail a check to:

The Frick Pittsburgh

Advancement & Engagement Department

7227 Reynolds St.

Pittsburgh, PA 15208

Other methods of giving include [gifts of appreciated stock or mutual funds](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/gifts-of-stock), which offer significant tax benefits without affecting your cash flow. Additionally, [qualified charitable distributions](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Qualified-Charitable-Distributions) from your Individual Retirement Account (IRA) are current gifts with an immediate impact.

See below for a full list of the benefits associated with supporting the museum as a member of The Frick Societies. For more information, contact Advancement & Engagement staff at 412-342-4086 or [Membership@TheFrickPittsburgh.org](mailto:membership@TheFrickPittsburgh.org).

### Benefits

**Frick Societies members enjoy [all the benefits of membership](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/membership), plus much more!**

- Complimentary admission to all paid programs, events, and workshops
- Unlimited complimentary admission and docent-led tours of Clayton, The Frick Art Museum and all touring exhibitions, and the Car and Carriage Museum
- Complimentary admission for **four** guests every time you visit Clayton and touring exhibitions
- Four complimentary guest passes to share with friends and family
- Complimentary admission to more than 1,400 museums in North America including The Frick Collection, New York
- Exclusive opportunity to make reservations in advance for special events
- 15% discount in the Frick Museum Store
- 10% discount at The Caf√©
- Recognition on signage in The Frick Art Museum

## The Frick Societies

#### [1882 Society - $1,000](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/the-frick-societies\#acc1-tab1)

1882 is the year that Henry Clay Frick purchased the Italianate-style home we know today as Clayton, the cornerstone of the Frick‚Äôs collections. Members of the 1882 Society are, likewise, cornerstones of the vital philanthropic support necessary to advance the museum‚Äôs mission.

#### [Rubens Society - $2,500](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/the-frick-societies\#acc1-tab2)

The Rubens Society is named after the renowned¬†seventeenth-century Flemish Baroque painter Peter Paul Rubens, whose¬†_Portrait of Charlotte-Marguerite de Montmorency, Princess of Cond√©_¬†(ca. 1610) is one of the most admired works in the Frick‚Äôs collection.

#### [Clayton Society - $5,000](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/the-frick-societies\#acc1-tab3)

Named for the enduring history of the Frick family‚Äôs Gilded Age home, the Clayton Society is composed of individuals committed to the sustainability and future of The Frick Pittsburgh. Recognized by Architectural Digest as "a triumph of restoration,"¬†Clayton is a stunning late-nineteenth-century mansion, and the only surviving example of a home on Pittsburgh‚Äôs lost "Millionaire‚Äôs Row."

#### [Helen Clay Frick Society - $10,000](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/the-frick-societies\#acc1-tab4)

The Helen Clay Frick Society honors the legacy of the Frick‚Äôs founder and benefactress. Members enjoy the distinction of being part of a vital group to support the Frick‚Äôs mission to provide memorable experiences with art, history, and nature that inspire and delight.

[![The Frick Pittsburgh Museums and Gardens Logo](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/User/logo.svg)](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/ "The Frick Pittsburgh Museums and Gardens Logo")

content:
##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

We never stop learning

# Learning at the Frick

We believe that every visit is an opportunity to learn, to be inspired and to be delighted by art, history and nature, and we offer many different opportunities to learn in ways that mean the most to you.

Take a guided tour of Clayton or explore the current exhibition on your own, join us for a workshop or a lunchtime lecture, or simply walk the grounds and feel refreshed. **We welcome you to visit and discover all that you can learn at the Frick.**

_Looking to schedule a field trip? January and February offer more flexibility in available dates. Consider scheduling a program during this time to save $2 per student. [Learn more and schedule today!](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//learn#education)_

### For Educators

Our hands-on learning programs for students K-12 are teacher friendly, address academic standards and use art, history, and nature to understand different times and contexts.¬† Frick programs address cross curricular standards, integrating writing, art, science and even economics to broaden student perspectives.

If you're interested in bringing your students to The Frick, our 2025-2026¬†School Programs Booklet is the best place to start the planning process. The booklet contains all of the information you need to plan an exciting, engaging field trip for your students, including program descriptions by grade level, lunch information, and tips for booking. By popular demand, we have also added an a la carte option that allows you to customize your own field trip experience! Download your free copy below.

[School Program¬†Booklet](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/School%2DProgram%2DBooklet%2D2025%2D2026%2D%283%29.pdf?d=2025924134119)

**If you plan to visit the Frick as a self-guided student group, please review our museum guidelines for self-guided groups ahead of your arrival.**

[View Guidelines](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/Museum%2DGuidelines%2Dfor%2DSelf%2DGuided%2DStudent%2DGroups%2Devergreen%2D2025.pdf?d=20254493241)

#### [School Programs](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//learn\#acc-tab2)

The Frick Pittsburgh is committed to offering engaging, thoughtful student programs both online and on-site in our three museums. Our programs explore the interdisciplinary nature of the Frick‚Äîfrom fine art in The Frick Art Museum, to life in the gilded age in Clayton, to the history of transportation in our Car and Carriage Museum.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/school-programs)

#### [Teacher Professional Development](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//learn\#acc-tab3)

At the Frick we not only welcome students, but teachers too!¬† Throughout the year we offer teacher workshops that focus on a wide variety of art, history, and other educational topics through multidisciplinary, standards-based workshops.¬† These programs offer Act 48 activity hours while providing teachers with fresh and practical classroom-ready suggestions.

[View Programs](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar?search=1&page=1&search_category=5)

#### [Learning Resources](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org//learn\#acc-tab4)

We offer a variety of multi-disciplinary resources designed to support educators at every grade level, regardless of whether they are teaching remotely or in the classroom.

[View Resources](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/classroomresources)

## Family Programs

The Frick Pittsburgh is a wonderful place to spend time with your family.¬† We offer programs throughout the year that give families the opportunity to engage together in hands-on learning through museum visits, art making, and outdoor activities on our grounds.¬†Our learning activities are for children of all ages.

[View Calendar](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar?search=1&page=1&search_category=2)

## Workshops

Nurture your creativity at The Frick! Young artists ages 11-14 will cultivate their imaginations with The Frick's teaching artists during monthly hands-on workshops. Each session is inspired by The Frick's museums or grounds, and includes a short tour experience followed by a guided art workshop.

[View Calendar](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar?search=1&page=1&search_keywords=workshop)

## Adult Programs

Throughout the year, the Frick Pittsburgh presents a wide variety of thoughtful, enlightening, and enjoyable programs for adults. From exhibition lectures and special events to classes and workshops, Frick programming offers numerous opportunities for adults to connect with our collections, exhibitions and each other.

[View Calendar](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/calendar?search=1&page=1&search_category=3)

## Outreach

We offer a variety of outreach programs for adults through local libraries, senior centers and community centers, and we also regularly host activity tables at community events throughout the city.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/outreach)

[![](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/RAD%5Fsmall.png)](https://www.radworkshere.org/)

[![](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/Admin/UPMC%2DHealth%2DPlan%2DLogo%2Din%2DColor%2D2016.jpg)](https://www.upmchealthplan.com/)

### Summer Camp

Art, History, Nature

Explore, imagine and create in Pittsburgh‚Äôs best backyard!

Enjoy a week filled with art making and explorations throughout the Frick‚Äôs museums.¬† Projects and content will be adjusted to fit each grade level.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/SummerCamp "Learn More")

[![The Frick Pittsburgh Museums and Gardens Logo](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Files/User/logo.svg)](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/ "The Frick Pittsburgh Museums and Gardens Logo")

##### The Caf√© at the Frick Update

Please note that The Caf√© at the Frick will serving a limited menu, packaged and served to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

## Dine in Pittsburgh's most beautiful setting

# The Caf√© at the Frick

**PLEASE NOTE:** The Caf√© at the Frick will be running a limited menu, packaged and served as to go, on October 3, 4, 5, and 7.

* * *

Enjoy casual dining with a picturesque view of Pittsburgh's best backyard. Sample savory lunch options, daily afternoon teas, curated coffees and cocktails, and more!

#### Summer Tea Series

Join us for a special Summer Tea Series at The Caf√© at the Frick! Enjoy sweet and savory offerings paired with exquisite tea. The Summer Tea Series will take place on the second Thursday of each month, from June through October.

[Learn More](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/Event-Summer-Tea-Series)

#### Skip the line and order ahead!

Online carry out orders are available every day The Caf√© at the Frick is open.

_Please note that online orders are for carry out only. A table will not be reserved for you if you order online._

[Order Online](https://order.spoton.com/pit-the-cafe-at-the-frick-11284/pittsburgh-pa/6352d22f74d0b3e716aefbce)

#### [Food Menu](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/cafe\#acc-tab3)

## STARTERS

**CHEESE BOARD**

Three varieties of cheese, honey, fresh fruit, crostini

**CHARCUTERIE BOARD**

Three selections from Parma sausage, olives, gherkins

**CELEBRATION BOARD**

A combination of cheese & charcuterie selections

**SESAME SEED SEARED AHI TUNA**

**SHRIMP COCKTAIL**

Lemon, cocktail sauce

**PIEROGI**

Caramelized onion, sour cream, chives

## BRUNCH

With strawberries, house-made clotted cream

_Bacon available for an extra charge_

**SMOKED SALMON FLATBREAD**

**QUICHE**

Sausage, spinach, wild mushroom

**DONUT HOLES**

Cake donuts, choice of: glazed, powdered sugar, cinnamon sugar, hot honey, plain

## SOUPS & SALADS

**SCRATCH MADE SOUP**

**CAF√â CAESAR SALAD**

Romaine, shaved Parmesan, croutons, classic dressing

_Add grilled chicken, smoked salmon, chilled shrimp, or sesame seed seared tuna for an extra charge_

**CAF√â HOUSE SALAD**

Mixed greens, cucumber, tomato, olives, carrots, pepita, balsamic vinaigrette

## SCANDINAVIAN INSPIRED

**BEET AND APPLE SALAD**

Tossed with sour cream, served with arugula and pumpernickel toast points

**SCALLOP CRUDO**

Ceviche scallops with strawberries, cucumbers, berry vinaigrette, poppyseeds

**ELK MEATLOAF**

Bacon laced meatloaf, topped with lingonberry sauce, served with roasted redskin potatoes

**FISH CAKES**

Cedar roasted salmon and cod, served with cucumber salad and caper remoulade

**HAM SANDWICH**

Open faced on pumpernickel toast, topped with pea and carrot salad, bibb lettuce, cucumber

## LUNCH

**SANDWICHES**

All sandwiches come with chips and a pickle spear

TURKEY

Roasted turkey breast, herb aioli, lettuce, tomato, red onion, brioche roll

_Swiss cheese available for an extra charge_

CHICKEN BAHN MI

Grilled chicken breast, lime juice, pickled carrots and red cabbage, cucumber, jalapeno, cilantro, mayo, toasted baguette

VEGETABLE WRAP

Romaine, red pepper hummus, tomato, carrots, cucumber, arugula

## AFTERNOON TEA

Choice of two finger sandwiches, choice of scone, house-made clotted cream, jam, sweets, and your choice of loose-leaf tea

## BAKED GOODS

A selection of baked goods from [Mediterra Bakehouse](https://www.mediterrabakehouse.com/), [Glen's Custard](https://glenscustard.com/), [Jak's Bakery](https://www.jaksbakery.com/), and others. Vegan options available.

Please inform your server of any food allergies and/or dietary restrictions.

Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have a medical condition.

#### [Drink Menu](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/cafe\#acc-tab4)

## COFFEE & TEA

**LA PRIMA**

Espresso, cappucino/latte, cold brew, drip

**HARNEY & SONS LOOSE-LEAF TEA**

**Black Tea**

Apricot, Chai, Chocolate Mint, English Breakfast, Helen's Earl Grey (Regular/Decaf), Frick (Assam, Keeman, Ceylon, Oolong), Paris, Rose, Russian Country

**Herbal & Green**

Chamomile, French Super Blue Lavender, Ginger Licorice, Peppermint, Raspberry, Tokyo

## BEVERAGES

**NON-ALCOHOLIC**

Iced Tea

Brazilian Lemonade

Lemonade

Arnold Palmer

Soda

Bottled Water

**FRICK HOUSE WINES**

Pinot Grigio

Chardonnay

Bubbles

Pinot Noir

Cabernet Sauvignon

**BEER**

Stella Artois

Bell's 2 Hearted

East End Big Hop

Seasonal

**COCKTAILS**

Frick 75

Bellini

Mimosa

Spiked Brazilian Lemonade

Bailey's & Mint Hot Chocolate

_Cocktails and wine available for dine in or carry out on our grounds_

#### [Crafted Cocktails and Marvelous Mocktails](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/cafe\#acc-tab5)

## CRAFTED COCKTAILS

**RED CAP SANGRIA**

Red wine sangria with cherry liqueur, lemon, oranges, cucumber, bitters

**THE YOUNG ARTIST**

Scotch, amaretto, bitters

**SHIELD BEARER**

Whiskey, lavender syrup, lemon juice

**BAROQUE**

Grapefruit vodka, fresh basil, hot honey, lime juice, soda water

**GARDEN MOJITO**

White rum, cucumber, jalape√±o, mint, lime

**LADY JULIA**

Espresso, vodka, cr√®me de cacao, cherry liqueur

**SYMPHONY IN GREY & GREEN**

Pernod, lavender & earl grey simple syrup, gin, fresh squeezed orange, bitters

## MARVELOUS MOCKTAILS

**THE POND**

Pineapple juice, basil, lime juice, soda water

**THE NOBLE WOMAN**

Strawberry syrup, basil, soda water

**THE PLAYHOUSE GARDEN**

Mint, cucumber, lime, simple syrup, soda water

_Cocktails and wine available for dine in or carry out on our grounds_

_Don't see your favorite? We can likely make it for you, so please ask!_

#### [Frequently Asked Questions](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/cafe\#acc-tab6)

We‚Äôve received a lot of inquiries about the current business model and future of the Caf√©. We thank you for your continued support and hope to answer some of your questions below.

**Why did you change the Caf√©? Wasn‚Äôt it already perfect?**

The atmosphere is magical, and we are committed to keeping it so. But certain aspects of the Caf√©‚Äôs pre-COVID business model didn't serve all of our visitors as well as they should. The adjustments we've made address some specific challenges:

In the past, the Caf√© served a small number of people very well, but the great majority of our visitors not at all. During our busiest months, from April to December, the Caf√© was fully booked at lunchtime days in advance. We routinely turned away two, three, and even four times as many people as we could seat. Without an opportunity for rest and refreshment, many visitors left the Frick before they could experience all we have to offer.

By expanding our open hours, we hope to increase the number of visitors we can serve. From quick-and-easy delights to special-occasion indulgences, we are aiming to meet the needs of as many of our visitors as possible.

###### Hours

**Tuesday‚ÄìSunday**

**9:30 AM‚Äì3 PM**

Reservations not accepted

The¬†Caf√© is wheelchair-accessible and has single-stall all-gender restrooms.

**We're hiring!** Learn more [here](https://www.thefrickpittsburgh.org/employment).

#### Caf√© Gift Cards

Share the joy of a trip to The Caf√© at the Frick with our gift cards! Treat your loved ones or yourself to a delicious meal in our garden getaway.

[Purchase Gift Card](https://egiftcards.spoton.com/11284/6352d22f74d0b3e716aefbce?returnUrl=https%3A%2F%2Forder.spoton.com%2Fpit-the-cafe-at-the-frick-11284%2Fpittsburgh-pa%2F6352d22f74d0b3e716aefbce&source=olo-web)
